detailedSummary: React Hooks enable using state and lifecycle features in functional components. useState manages component state. useEffect handles side effects (API calls, subscriptions, DOM manipulation) and replaces lifecycle methods. useEffect runs after render and can have dependencies. Cleanup functions in useEffect prevent memory leaks. useContext accesses React context without prop drilling. useReducer manages complex state with reducers. useMemo memoizes expensive calculations. useCallback memoizes functions to prevent unnecessary re-renders. useRef creates mutable references that don't trigger re-renders. Custom hooks encapsulate reusable logic. Rules of hooks: only call hooks at the top level, not in loops/conditions. Functional components with hooks are preferred over class components for simpler syntax, better performance, and easier testing. Understanding hooks enables building modern React applications with clean, reusable code.
whyItMatters: React Hooks are the modern way to build React applications - they simplify code, improve reusability, and are essential for professional React development.

assignments.title: Build Applications with React Hooks
assignments.description: Create React applications using various hooks to manage state, side effects, and component logic.
tasks: Use useState and useEffect hooks to manage component state and side effects
Implement useContext to share data across components without prop drilling
Use useMemo and useCallback to optimize performance
Create custom hooks to encapsulate reusable logic
Build a complex application demonstrating multiple hooks working together

quizzes.question: What is the main purpose of the useEffect hook?
options: To handle side effects like API calls, subscriptions, and DOM manipulation
quizzes.explanation: useEffect handles side effects in functional components, replacing lifecycle methods like componentDidMount, componentDidUpdate, and componentWillUnmount.

quizzes.question: Hooks can be called conditionally or inside loops.
quizzes.explanation: False. Hooks must be called at the top level of components, not conditionally or in loops, to ensure consistent hook order across renders.

quizzes.question: What is the purpose of useMemo?
options: To memoize expensive calculations and prevent unnecessary recalculations
quizzes.explanation: useMemo memoizes the result of expensive calculations, only recalculating when dependencies change, improving performance.
